page.title: 13Oakley Hunt, Melchbourne
page.content: The Oakley Hunt Kennels are situated on the Knotting Road, approximately 1.5 miles west of Melchbourne. The Kennels moved here from Milton Ernest in 1974. The buildings were all purpose built and include; housing for the staff, lodges for the hounds,stables for the hunt horses plus many barns and outbuildings. The hunting season begins on 1st. November and Meets take place on Tuesdays and Saturdays. Prior to the hunting season andas soon as the harvest has been completed, cub hunting starts. This spreads the litters of cubs and is also used to train young hounds. It is done over a limited area, unlike hunting where the hope is to run a long way. The O akley Hunt covers North Bedfordshire and parts of northants and Bucks.
